tool.name: Submit Gene Set
tool.command: ../bin/cfo_run_cmd.pl $cmd --data-file=$gene_set_file --data-type="$data_type" #if $id_type.value != "?" --id-type="$id_type" #if $id_type.value == "GeneSymbol" and $organism.value != "?" --organism="$organism" #end if #end if --orig-filename="$gene_set_file.name" --report-file=$report --report-as-html --no-processed-file-output #if $cmd.value == False: --gene-set-name="$gene_set_name" --gene-set-desc="$gene_set_desc" #if $overwrite_existing.value == True --overwrite-existing #end if #end if

param.name: gene_set_file
param.label: Gene Set File to Check, Process and Submit

param.name: id_type
param.label: Gene Set IDs From
param.help: OPTIONAL: select ID type if not already set in data file header

param.name: organism
param.label: Organism
param.help: OPTIONAL: select organism if your IDs are gene symbols (i.e. #%id_type=GeneSymbol) AND organism not already set in data file header

param.name: gene_set_name
param.label: Gene Set Name
param.help: OPTIONAL: specify gene set name if not already set in data file header or you don't want to use file base name as gene set name

param.name: gene_set_desc
param.label: Gene Set Description
param.help: OPTIONAL: specify dataset description if not already set in data file header. Please do not put manual carriage returns in the text area

param.name: cmd
param.label: Process and Check Gene Set Only
param.help: Check this if you want to only check and map your gene set file and review the report but not submit anything to the Confero database

param.name: overwrite_existing
param.label: Overwrite Any Existing Gene Set
param.help: Check this if you want to force overwrite of all data for any existing gene set in the database with the same name

tool.help:
This tool will::
1. Check, process, map and collapse a source ID list file into an Entrez Gene ID-based gene set list using latest source platform annnotations and NCBI Entrez Gene database.
2. Submit ID list, gene set and all metadata into the Confero DB.
The tool provides a summary report of the procedure as output.
If you do not have file to choose from in the Gene Set File drop-down menu, it's because you have no files of this format in your Galaxy history. You first need to do the following::
* Go to Get Data --> Upload File, select File Format cfogenedataset, browse for and upload your ID list file.
IMPORTANT INFORMATION::
* All header metadata fields begin with a #% and have an = after the field name and before the field data. Field data with spaces must be quoted " ". All header metadata fields must be at the top of the file, before any data. Here is an example:
#%gene_set_name="Inflammatory Response" #%gene_set_desc="The immediate defensive reaction (by vertebrate tissue) to infection or injury caused by chemical or physical agents. The process is characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages." #%id_type=GeneSymbol #%organism="Homo sapiens"
* Various header metadata fields in your contrast file are supported. These currently are::
- gene_set_name - gene_set_desc - id_type - organism (specify only gene symbols are your IDs (#%id_type=GeneSymbol) Confero will automatically determine organism for all other ID types) - gs_is_ranked (specify if gene set list is ordered by rank so that rank order will be saved in Confero DB)
* Various additional annotation metadata fields are supported. These currently are::
- system - study_no - cell_tissue - stimulus
* Metadata headers must be at the top file, before any data column header or data. They should have the following format shown in the example below::
#%gene_set_desc="The immediate defensive reaction (by vertebrate tissue) to infection or injury caused by chemical or physical agents. The process is characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages." #%id_type=GeneSymbol #%organism="Homo sapiens"
* If the metadata header gene_set_name is not included, the basename of the file will be used for the gene set name.
* If you already have certain metadata fields in your file header then you should ignore the OPTIONAL web form menus to specify these fields.
* ID list format example, e.g. Inflammatory_Response.txt with gene symbols as IDs (though IDs can be from any supported source platform)::
#%gene_set_desc="The immediate defensive reaction (by vertebrate tissue) to infection or injury caused by chemical or physical agents. The process is characterized by local vasodilation, extravasation of plasma into intercellular spaces and accumulation of white blood cells and macrophages." #%id_type=GeneSymbol #%organism="Homo sapiens" ABCF1 ADORA1 ADORA2A ADORA3 AFAP1L2 AGER AHSG AIF1 ALOX15 ALOX5AP ANXA1 AOAH AOC3 AOX1 APCS APOL3 BLNK ...
